author: @starrberryshortcakes
text: Props to FD for having the collaborative mindset, introducing me to so many progressive Black creators. Props to you Olay for bringing them together in a way that has not only filled the discourse gap I was missing with the Grapevine ended but has ELEVATED it. Love your solo content as well. Props to Foreign for sneaking the diaspora discussion past Olay. ðŸ¤£  I feel like this diaspora was is the internet fiction of a loud minority.  In *my* reality as a Black American woman the crew has always been comprised of american, Caribbean and continental African Black folks. I hate that folks come at you Olay I get the sense that it affects you greatly. Please know thereâ€™s a silent majority who feel nothing but kinship across the diaspora. I appreciate our similarities as well as the uniqueness of our varied experiences (and foods) ðŸ˜†.

author: @BobDole1216
text:
As a very white person who is queer and trans, the majority of my political content at this point comes from racialized black people thanks to stumbling upon Fiq a couple years ago. The clichÃ© about a rising tide lifting all ships and what you talked about with regards to there being space for many people is so true and I'm incredibly grateful for everyone who played a part in cultivating that environment of collaboration. There's no way in hell the algorithm would have ever recommended me Khadija, Foreign, lil bill, etc. but I catch every video now and it never stops exciting me seeing people I think are awesome showing up on each others' videos.

"A candle lighting another candle does not diminish the flame, it only makes the world brighter."

author: @gothwolf13
text:
As a white American viewer, I really appreciate you two and it's always lovely to hear your perspective on things <3 I don't need any more ragebaity vids about this or that republican, I much prefer vids with real substance. And personally, I prefer when people are able to speak freely on things they feel passionate about rather than putting on kiddie gloves by tailoring it to a white/U.S. audience. I can always look something up if I don't understand it. 

Before I found you both and Andrewism, I had never heard any perspectives from the Caribbean. I'd love to see more collab vids with other creators you'd like to boost.

author: @lloroshastar6347
text: I wish we would stop this whole 'this is a Conservative culture' line, there is no 'Conservative culture', the politics of nations changes regularly and so do its people. Human beings frequently shift from left to right throughout their lives, some even go from one extreme to another and then end up being moderates by the end of their lives. As someone from the UK I get sick of being labelled 'from a Conservative culture', we can be Conservative on many issues yes but we're a damn sight more progressive in many ways than a lot of countries. Individuals are Conservative or Progressive, not countries or cultures. It wasn't that long ago people were talking about France as a 'progressive country' now they are on the verge of electing Fascists, whereas here in the UK we are on the verge of kicking out most of our right-wing politicians and replacing them by and large with centrists, but nobody is going to say 'the UK is a predominantly centrist nation', no you're all going to be pointing to our colonialist past and the fact we are the home to the Queen TERF, and actual leftists like me are going to be erased as non-existent once again and told I don't exist. I mean the US likes to think of itself as progressive but most of the world views it as one of the most Conservative countries on the planet. Now of course its the same thing, varies very much from State to State, and some States flip. Florida went from being on the verge of flipping to Democrat to electing a Fascist as governor. It really isn't as simple as so many try to make it out to be.

replies.author: @olurinatti
replies.text: I hear you but respectfully, The Bahamas is a constitutionally Christian nation, it is in fact conservative and most people there are too. Maybe the UK and wherever else may shift depending on what have you but the island that Foreign and I are from is 21x7 miles long and weâ€™re a tiny people so you canâ€™t really compare what weâ€™re telling you about the culture of our country to massive places like the UK or America and whatever your experience is as a leftist there.

replies.author: @lloroshastar6347
replies.text: @olurinatti well that's really sad I hope the Bahamas will change even if it's gonna take some time. But I guess my feelings are born out of frustration, because I hear people call us 'TERF island' all the time as if we're a hive mind but there are plenty of people here who don't feel that way and a lot of US YouTubers just discount us like we don't exist, but I'm a loud and proud trans ally and there are millions of us in the UK who feel that way and are doing our hardest to fight against transphobia here and it does hurt to hear progressives in the US just write us off like we don't exist, along with the trans people who also live here and have to suffer due to our political and media class. So I feel bad for all those in the Bahamas such as yourself and Foreign being drowned out by the Conservative establishment there too. Your voices deserve to be heard just as progressives and leftists in the UK deserve to be heard and platformed.
